techniques.Name: Long Pause
techniques.Description: Long Pauses are extremely useful in many situations during presentations.

techniques.Name: Comparison
techniques.Description: It is a good practice to support your verbal message with the same gesture such as: showing one hand while saying On the one hand

techniques.Name: Ending Low tone
techniques.Description: Ending with a low tone tends to command respect and can be used when calling the audience for some action

techniques.Name: Chin Up
techniques.Description: Having a chin up helps to be perceived as confident

techniques.Name: Showing Palms
techniques.Description: Showing your palms will make you look more open and warm

techniques.Name: Enumeration Gestures
techniques.Description: You can use gestures to signal the different points you want to communicate

techniques.Name: High Pitch Signal
techniques.Description: You can change the tone of your voice to signal a new topic

techniques.Name: Iconic Gesture
techniques.Description: Iconic Gestures are engaging and can help you to describe the scenario better

techniques.Name: Quotes
techniques.Description: Use the space and change orientation when telling some quotes as if you are creating an avatar of the person that said the quote

techniques.Name: Space Side
techniques.Description: Use the space of the stage to signal: Time, direction, etc.

techniques.Name: Back and front
techniques.Description: You can use the space and volume to signal theoretical and personal stuff

techniques.Name: Stress words
techniques.Description: You can use your voice to stress what is important

techniques.Name: Emphatic Gestures
techniques.Description: You can use Emphatic Gestures to stress what is important
